title: Em dash not rightly encoded as form param type string as part of a MultipartForm
body:
### Describe the bug

Sending a MultipartForm with a Em dash in a string, it is not rightly encoded and appears as a ? char.

### Expected behavior

Em dash is rightly encoded.

### Actual behavior

Sending a MultipartForm with a Em dash in a string, it is not rightly encoded and appears as a ? char.

### How to Reproduce?

https://github.com/hantsy/quarkus-sandbox/tree/master/multipart

You can use this example and there is a test to check the multipartform. As an example you set the field test as
... 
given().formParam("test", "â€”")
...

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

Linux alex-workstation 5.19.0-32-generic #33~22.04.1-Ubuntu SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Mon Jan 30 17:03:34 UTC 2 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux alex@alex-workstation:~$ 

### Output of `java -version`

openjdk version "17" 2021-09-14
OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 17+35-2724)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (build 17+35-2724, mixed mode, sharing)

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

Quarkus 3.0.0.Alpha4

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Apache Maven 3.8.2

### Additional information

_No response_
